00032 //***************************************************************************** 
00033 // FAP static parameters
00034 //*****************************************************************************
00035 
00036 #define FAP_DATARATE HAL_NRF_2MBPS    // 2Mbps datarate 
00037 
00038 #define FAP_OUTPUT_POWER HAL_NRF_0DBM // 0 dBm output power 
00039 #define FAP_CRC HAL_NRF_CRC_16BIT     // 16 bit CRC (maximum)
00040 #define FAP_ADDRESS_WIDTH 5           // 5 byte address
00041 #define FAP_LP_RX_LISTEN_PERIODS 1    // Low power RX on time                                       
00042 
00043 #if(FAP_MAX_FW_PL_LENGTH > FAP_MAX_ACK_PL_LENGTH)
00044   #define FAP_MAX_PL_LENGTH FAP_MAX_FW_PL_LENGTH 
00045 #else
00046   #define FAP_MAX_PL_LENGTH FAP_MAX_ACK_PL_LENGTH 
00047 #endif
00048          
00049 #if(FAP_MAX_ACK_PL_LENGTH > 15)
00050   #define FAP_AUTO_RETR_DELAY 500       
00051 #else
00052   #define FAP_AUTO_RETR_DELAY 250       
00053 #endif  
00054 
00055 #define FAP_MAX_TX_PERIOD (130+37+(FAP_MAX_FW_PL_LENGTH*4)+FAP_AUTO_RETR_DELAY)    
00056 
00057 //***************************************************************************** 
00058 // Misc. macros
00059 //*****************************************************************************
00060 
00061 #define FAP_GET_BIT(a, b) ((a >> b) & 0x01)
00062 #define FAP_CLEAR_BIT(a, b) (a &= ~(1 << b))
00063 #define FAP_SET_BIT(a, b) (a |= (1 << b)) 
00064

00073 #define FAP_RADIO_PWR_UP_DELAY ((2000/FAP_RX_PERIOD)+1)   // ~ 2 ms radio startup
00074 
00081 #define FAP_TX_SINGLE_CH_REV ((FAP_NRF_AUTO_RETRIES+1)*FAP_AUTO_RETRIES_EXTEND)//[#]  
00082 
00083 /*
00084 Equals the maximum time in [us] the transmitter resides on a single channel before 
00085 channel switch. This parameter is derived from the device maximum payload length.
00086 */  
00087 #define FAP_TX_SINGLE_CH_REV_TIME (FAP_TX_SINGLE_CH_REV*FAP_TX_PERIOD_MAX)//[us]
00088 
00089 /*
00090 Equals the number of transmit periods necessary  for a full revolution
00091 through all channels. It is recommended that the transmit timeout period 
00092 specified when using fap_tx_data() is equal or greater than this value.
00093 The maximum length of one transmit period in [us] is specified by #FAP_MAX_TX_PERIOD.
00094 */
00095 #define FAP_TX_FULL_CH_REV (FAP_TX_SINGLE_CH_REV*FAP_CH_TAB_SIZE)//[#]
00096 
00097 /*
00098 Equals the time in [us] necessary for the transmitter to revolve through 
00099 all channels.
00100 */
00101 #define FAP_TX_FULL_CH_REV_TIME (FAP_TX_FULL_CH_REV*FAP_TX_PERIOD_MAX)//[us]
00102 
00108 #define FAP_RX_SINGLE_CH_REV ((uint16_t)(((FAP_TX_SINGLE_CH_REV*FAP_MAX_TX_PERIOD)/FAP_RX_PERIOD)+1))//[#]
00109 
00117 void fap_modify_timer_period(void);
00118           
00124 #define FAP_RX_SINGLE_CH_REV_TIME (FAP_RX_SINGLE_CH_REV*FAP_RX_PERIOD) //[us]
00125 
00131 #define FAP_RX_FULL_CH_REV (FAP_RX_SINGLE_CH_REV*FAP_CH_TAB_SIZE) // [#]
00132 
00138 #define FAP_RX_FULL_CH_REV_TIME (RX_FULL_CH_REV*FAP_RX_PERIOD) // [us]
